page.title: 19CONSERVATION & BISHOP BURTON
page.content: In the last few years everyone has become aware of the conflict between modern farming and wildlife conservation. FWAG (Farming and Wildlife Advisory Group) was set up in the 1970's to try to make farmers aware of the problems, to give practical advice to farmers wanting to accommodate wildlife on their farms and to educate the public. North Humberside FWAG was the first group set up, its meetings being held at Bishop Burton College of Agriculture and attracting farmers from all around the county. A FWAG advisor has this year been appointed to visit farms and advise farmers. A seminar on land use was held at the college in November, 1985 and attracted over 60 people. It was chaired by the TV personality, author and landscape architect, Chris Baines.
